title: Appeal
body:
Hello riot, I have read and understood that you don't appeal these bans however I feel that I this ban was wrongfully banned.

I understand the fact that my behavior was not in the right however my teammate was giving me an attitude towards me as he was clearly accusing me of my game play and my behavior towards the player led me to tilt. 
While I did text "kys" and "%%%got" I believe that this ban was not reasonable as I have seem worse in game text.
Usually, I would never get this point I can deal with this type of behavior but this time I was not being myself.

Thanks and hopefully you could understand my point of view.

replies.body:
>my teammate was giving me an attitude 

>I did text "kys" and "%%%got"

So just because someone was being a jerk in a video game they should end their life? You should be entitled to use homophobic slurs?

Suicide encouragement and discriminatory slurs (racism, sexism, homophobia etc) are all classed as no tolerance language for which you receive on a single warning (14 day, perma if you have already received that 14 day for chat offences).

You can appeal the punishment through [player support](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) if you really want to, but I can basically guarantee it will not be removed or reduced.

> [{quoted}](name=Seras Dragon,realm=OCE,application-id=ElA0rvVL,discussion-id=2a22Q4EE,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2018-12-29T10:30:14.817+0000)
>
> So just because someone was being a jerk in a video game they should end their life? You should be entitled to use homophobic slurs?


bro, if they cant handle low tier stuff like that, i kinda think they should get off the internet while they're ahead tbh....

It seems we have rather different ideas of what classifies as 'low-tier'. Even so, I'm unsure how it is relevant. 

He broke one of the strongest rules in the book (others including cheating, mature content), it would be rather strange for him not to see punishment.

Just because someone telling me to kill myself isn't going to result in *me* doing that, does not in any way excuse the behaviour *or* the mindset that would prompt someone to believe that saying something like that would in any way be okay.
